intro: Euphrasia debilis, commonly known as the slender eyebright, is a small annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers bloom in early summer. Euphrasia debilis is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological features. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
